content.description:
On the right side of the cliff, follow the bolted line up and eventually traverse left under a roof to a ledge. Belay from here either with small cams or build an anchor off the bolts on Hubble route. Continue up the second pitch, and scramble off or rap with double ropes.

This climbs fun, standard Platte slab!
content.protection: Pitch one is 130' long and has 8 bolts. Pitch two is 60' long and has 5 bolts. Bring two long runners for bolts 7 and 8.
content.location: It climbs the right side of the pillar at the base of the cliff.

content.description:
Pinball Wizard Drifter has fun climbing in the chimney to the left of

Sheep Skin

and tops out on second pitch of

Hubble’s Route

. Follow five bolts up the first pitch with a #5 and #6 for the top of the chimney approximately 110'  working left to the ramp P2 of

Hubble’s Route

. It's a fun squeeze! For the P1 belay, bring cord for the bolts or small gear for the crack. It joins the

Hubble’s Route

. We had mild 60-80 mph gusts for this fun route. It gets excellent afternoon shade.
content.protection: Quickdraws, long runners, #5 & #6 BDs or bigger if you have it and want it, long cord or small cams for the P1 belay on the ramp left of the roof.
content.location:
This is the right chimney just left of

Sheep Skin

.

climbs.name: One Divides Into Two
climbs.fa: Darren Mabe, Peter Hubbel, A2+, Winter 2004. FFA: Scott Curtis, Greg Miller, 9/19 (both on lead)

content.description:
In 2004, Darren and Pete's original plans changed due to snow on Sheeprock, so they decided to make the most of their time by aiding this angling seam, in mountain boots nonetheless!

With permission, I added 3 bolts to the A2 crux and an anchor.

Climb a right-angling finger crack that eventually becomes a seam, compress, and balance your way up the blunt arete past two bolts before a desperate move to a flake at the last bolt. Undercling your way to the anchor.
content.protection: Pro to 1", 3 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: The route faces the road and starts left of a pine tree.

content.description:
P1: climb a hand crack.

P2: go up a bolted slab.
content.location: It is on the left side of the crag.
